02.orig_text: The American computer company Apple has reached 78 percent increase in its profits during the last quarter, which ended December 30, 2006.
02.text: The American computer company Apple has reached 78 percent increase in its profits during the last quarter, which ended December 30, 2006.

03.orig_text: This fact is explained by great demand enjoyed by Apple's iPod digital music players during the Christmas and New Year sales period.
03.text: This fact is explained by great demand enjoyed by Apple's iPod digital music players during the Christmas and New Year sales period.

04.orig_text: As a result of successful Christmas sales, the very beginning of the financial year marked a double increase of the Apple's sales if compared to the $ 565 million profit reaped during the same period of the last year.
04.text: As a result of successful Christmas sales, the very beginning of the financial year marked a double increase of the Apple's sales if compared to the $ 565 million profit reaped during the same period of the last year.

05.orig_text: The company gained the record-breaking $ 1 billion.

06.orig_text: The overall annual revenue of the company made up $ 7.1 billion in 2006, having boosted from $5.8 billion in 2005.
06.text: The overall annual revenue of the company made up $ 7.1 billion in 2006, having boosted from $5.8 billion in 2005.

07.orig_text: The company's revenue growth is partially explained by the fact that the laptops produced by Apple are also found among the bestsellers.
07.text: The company's revenue growth is partially explained by the fact that the laptops produced by Apple are also found among the bestsellers.

08.orig_text: Even the Wall Street experts have not broadcasted such remarkable results for the Apple computer company.
08.text: Even the Wall Street experts have not broadcasted such remarkable results for the Apple computer company.

09.orig_text: Apple's results were way ahead of market expectations.
09.text: Apple's results were way ahead of market expectations.

10.orig_text: Its net profit has made up $1.14 per share, while Wall Street expected just 77 cents.
10.text: Its net profit has made up $1.14 per share, while Wall Street expected just 77 cents.

11.orig_text: During the first quarter of the financial year Apple Inc. sold more than 21 million iPod players and about 1.6 million computers - it implies the respective growth of 28% and 50% again compared to the previous year.
11.text: During the first quarter of the financial year Apple Inc. sold more than 21 million iPod players and about 1.6 million computers - it implies the respective growth of 28% and 50% again compared to the previous year.

12.orig_text: As soon as the results were announced at the New York Stock Exchange, the shares of the American computer company increased by 5 percent.
12.text: As soon as the results were announced at the New York Stock Exchange, the shares of the American computer company increased by 5 percent.

13.orig_text: It should be mentioned that the stock capital of Apple Inc tripled in 2004, doubled in 2005 and increased by 16 percent in 2006.
13.text: It should be mentioned that the stock capital of Apple Inc tripled in 2004, doubled in 2005 and increased by 16 percent in 2006.

14.orig_text: The steady growth is also due to considerable sales of its iPods and computers.

15.orig_text: Last week the company presented the iPhone.
